results.title: Overcoming resistance to change [B/W]
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Films

results.title: Overcoming Neck and Back Pain
results.creator_credit: G Roberts, Garry Egger and Centre for Health Promotion and Research
results.brief_description: Produced by a panel of back care experts in co-operation with the Royal Australian College of GP’s, this video is designed to provide information about back pain as well as a comprehensive exercise routine for dealing with and preventing back pain. Section 1: Basic back structure; Section 2: Day to day back care Section 3: Exercise routine.

results.title: Over to you
results.brief_description: This film describes a less familiar application of Marshall Aid - visits to America by teams from many countries to study productivity. In Britain such teams are organised by the Anglo-Amnerican Productivity Council which, in 1950, assembled the team from Britain’s hosiery industry and trade unions, whose tour of the United States, followed by the preparation of its report, is here recorded.
results.description: This film describes a less familiar application of Marshall Aid - visits to America by teams from many countries to study productivity. results.title: Over the Andes in Ecuador
results.creator_credit: Public Media and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: The major difficulties restricting Ecuador’s development are illustrated by the journey of a crate to a tiny village in the Amazon Basin. Also shows the standard of living, and the differences between the cities of Guayaquil and Quito. (Edited version of an Institut fur Film und Bild, Munich film.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Public Media and Institut für Film und Bild
results.description: The major difficulties restricting Ecuador’s development are illustrated by the journey of a crate to a tiny village in the Amazon Basin. Also shows the standard of living, and the differences between the cities of Guayaquil and Quito. (Edited version of an Institut fur Film und Bild, Munich film.)

results.title: Over in the meadow
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: For generations children have sung and loved this gay, counting song in which flowers, animals and birds, mothers and babies have provided the delightful setting for a lesson in numbers and nature. In this version lively vignettes in stunning colours make ideal company for the rhythmic pattern of the text.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios

results.title: Over in 3 weeks
results.creator_credit: Tom Ross, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Once Tom Ross and his fellow soldiers settled in Singapore, the bombing started. In three weeks, they were captured and sent to Changi, where Ross was a prisoner of war for three and a half years. Despite the abject conditions, Ross managed to survive through sheer determination and will to live.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Ross, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Once Tom Ross and his fellow soldiers settled in Singapore, the bombing started.
